image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: SA's Public Service Association has called for urgent reform, claiming three prisoners have been violently assaulted by other inmates in the past week — with each incident resulting in hospitalisations.

title.children: Prisoner in hospital after third violent attack in week, SA union says

image.altText: Tom Campbell poses with a football at the MCG after signing with Melbourne

props.synopsis: They're the backbone of every sporting team, the bench players who spend months or even years waiting to get their moment in the spotlight.

title.children: Here's to bench warmers, the unsung heroes of sporting teams

image.altText: Five children sit on a fence with a sign that reads 'Devonborough Downs'., wear hats, sky with white clouds, brown earth.

props.synopsis: Families on remote outback stations say they've been left in the lurch after a student boarding house closed suddenly.

title.children: Outback parents scramble to find accommodation after hostel closure

image.altText: Smoke billowing from steelworks into a cloudy sky

props.synopsis: When the new administrators of the Whyalla steelworks arrived on site two weeks ago, one of the first things they noticed was the traffic lights on the way in weren't working — as they looked over its assets and finances, things only got worse.

title.children: Administrators 'shocked' by the state of Whyalla's steelworks

image.altText: Smiling woman in black one-piece bathers in waist deep clear ocean water holding a bucket and a phone up

props.synopsis: An amateur fisherman's ingenious plan to use his phone to monitor his fishing reel backfired when it floated out to sea in a bucket. He couldn't believe his luck when the phone turned up three days later.

title.children: Phone lost at sea turns up after floating for three days and 20km in bucket

image.altText: A mother plays with her kid, drawing at a table.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence and child protection workers could leave if South Australia pushes ahead with proposed guidelines for a national-first social worker registration scheme, advocates are warning.

title.children: Concerns 'children could die' under proposed details for social worker registration scheme

image.altText: Steve Gillis looks ahead wearing a black polo shirt as he stands on a golf course

props.synopsis: Steve Gillis spent months trying to find answers to the "constant companions" of tinnitus, brain fog and visual disturbances that followed him after he had recovered from a virus. Now there are hopes others with visual snow syndrome will face an easier path to diagnosis.

title.children: 'Huge relief' for visual snow syndrome patients after WHO inclusion

image.altText: People walking on a footpath with arches of a 19th century stone building

props.synopsis: The result of an Adelaide City Council ward election in 2022 was affected by "illegal practices" involving people handling ballot papers that were not issued to them, a court has found, in a ruling which could trigger supplementary elections.

title.children: 'Illegal practices' affected Adelaide City Council election result, judge finds

image.altText: Queen Omega looks at camera with colourful braids in her hair

props.synopsis: After 25 years in the game, Queen Omega is enjoying her biggest success yet.

title.children: After hundreds of millions of views, Queen Omega finally visits Australia

image.altText: A dancer in Pina Bausch work Café Müller. In a nightdress, she wraps her arms around her body, eyes emotively closed

props.synopsis: A dance masterpiece never seen in Australian before — except on grainy video recordings — is about to be performed. It's been described as a life-changing work of art.

title.children: Eyes closed, stumbling, naked: These dancers are like nothing you've seen

image.altText: Peter Dutton scratches his head, dressed in a suit in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton, speaking while trapped by flooding at his Dickson home, has dismissed criticism of his decision to attend a fundraiser in Sydney as ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred approached.

title.children: Peter Dutton defends 'diary commitments' in Sydney as cyclone approached

image.altText: A tall white and black building that says 'The Star' at the top, with tall palm trees in the foreground against blue sky

props.synopsis: Casino operator Star Entertainment is mulling a bid from US gaming giant Bally's, that would give it at least $250 million in funding, in exchange for a controlling stake in the group.

title.children: Star receives last-minute $250 million offer from US giant Bally's

image.altText: Dave Hughes

props.synopsis: Dave Hughes based his comedy career on the embarrassing moments of his life. Now he's ready to talk about the terrifying ones.

title.children: When Dave Hughes gave up alcohol, he swapped one problem for another

image.altText: A woman in a red top and wearing glasses claps her hands.

props.synopsis: Counting is ongoing in the WA seat of Fremantle where incumbent MP Simone McGurk is trying to hold off an election challenge from independent Kate Hulett.

title.children: Fremantle neck and neck as WA Labor minister fights for survival

image.altText: An exterior shot of a building with the Suncorp logo

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has ended slightly higher on Monday, reversing a six-month low, while insurance stocks have climbed since ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred has been downgraded.

title.children: Insurance stocks rise after cyclone downgrade, ASX bounces back — as it happened

image.altText: A woman wearing a pink and orange singlet and shiny sunglasses running.

props.synopsis: Around 200 people have turned out in Canberra's south to take part in a solidarity run, after a female runner was allegedly grabbed by a man at Tuggeranong Hill last weekend.

title.children: Runners make a stand after woman allegedly grabbed by man while jogging

image.altText: A man in a beanie smiles at the camera, holding a large fish

props.synopsis: A court has heard the former NSW police officer described himself online as a "dirty paedo dad" and was prepared to pay for "underage fantasy and kink".

title.children: Former police officer requested porn with girls 'as young as possible'

image.altText: A man shoveling away sand

props.synopsis: Communities in the southern Gold Coast and Northern Rivers cope with the backwash of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred but say it's not a bad outcome compared to past disasters.

title.children: Alfred-hit communities assess the damage, even as more threats loom

image.altText: Three cars surrounded by floodwater

props.synopsis: About 300 millimetres of rain fell within two hours in Hervey Bay on Sunday. The mayor says the town was unprepared because of a lack of warnings.

title.children: Hervey Bay mayor questions why weather bureau failed to warn of flooding

image.altText: A tree that has fallen onto a house.

props.synopsis: Treacherous beaches, fallen powerlines and infectious, debris-riddled floodwater are among some of the hazards being identified as the recovery from ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred gets underway.

title.children: Sharks, disease and mental torment among Alfred clean-up risks

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A ute surrounded by floodwater with Clayton's towing in the background.

props.synopsis: Flood warnings have been issued for the region and several roads are closed after the hinterland copped a massive overnight downpour.

title.children: Multiple people rescued from cars after flash flooding hits Sunshine Coast

image.altText: A beach at low tide with a cloudy sky

props.synopsis: Police say a surfer was seen in distress at Wharton Beach after a shark sighting. A surfboard has been located but the surfer has not been found.

title.children: Authorities responding to reported shark attack near Esperance

image.altText: Virat Kohli holds up Champions Trophy as teammates celebrate

props.synopsis: India's triumph at the 2025 Champions Trophy is the crowning moment for the world's best white ball team. Sadly, many won't see it that way, through no fault of the players themselves, writes Chris de Silva.

title.children: India’s Champions Trophy win a tainted one despite team’s dominance

image.altText: Gold Coast Titans training ground impacted by flooding from ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred

props.synopsis: Severe flooding of their training venue forces Gold Coast to relocate to Sydney for the week ahead of their NRL season opener against Canterbury, while the Brisbane Lions will head south for sunnier conditions too.

title.children: 'Water well above the crossbar': Queensland footy teams head south to escape floods

image.altText: On an exhibition floor a man stands in front of a display of machine guns and rifles. A sign above says Thales.

props.synopsis: The national symbol for Australia's fallen soldiers has taken large sums of money from weapons makers, a move former staff call "inappropriate".

title.children: Critics slam weapons makers' war memorial funding as 'disgusting'

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at a press conference, in front of the Israeli and American flags.

props.synopsis: Israel's energy minister declared the country would cut off electricity supplies to Gaza, effective immediately, one week after all aid deliveries were halted.

title.children: Israel cuts off power supplies to Gaza ahead of ceasefire talks

image.altText: Trump rests his fingertips together at his desk in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: What's most important for Australia — and the entire Western world — is that America has fallen to anti-globalists, and they are carrying out a deep regime change in the style of an autocratic takeover.

title.children: America's future hinges on one important question

image.altText: Two Chinese dragons, one with a white head and another with a black, in front of a large crowd.

props.synopsis: High temperatures in Melbourne have failed to keep crowds away from the colour and celebrations of the annual Moomba Festival.

title.children: Record crowds flock to Moomba Festival

image.altText: Three women watch a television at a group function

props.synopsis: While most seats have a clear winner, there are several that are going down to the wire as counting continues in the 2025 WA election.

title.children: These are the seats still on a knife edge as WA election vote counting continues

image.altText: Yellow and blue for lease sign with red leased sticker over

props.synopsis: Rising rental prices in the West Australian town of Broome are forcing residents to take drastic measures and driving some out of town.

title.children: Broome residents forced to rethink as median rental price hits $1,000 a week

image.altText: Men in Chinese military uniforms march

props.synopsis: Taiwan is a potential flashpoint for a war between China and the United States, which is the island's most important backer and biggest arms supplier.

title.children: Beijing warns it will tighten 'noose' around Taiwan over separatism

image.altText: Black and white image of a young man in a hat cuddling with a dog on a wicker chair

props.synopsis: The youngest son of Prince Robert of Luxembourg and Princess Julie of Nassau died in Paris from PolG mitochondrial disease, his father says.

title.children: Luxembourg's Prince Frederik dies at 22 from rare genetic condition

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, in a black suit, at a press conference, with a soldier admiral behind him in uniform.

props.synopsis: There is a startling new figure that will make Anthony Albanese and his Labor team very nervous going into this pre-election season.

title.children: Survey about how we see the future should worry politicians

props.synopsis: Former central banker Mark Carney has won the race to become leader of Canada's ruling Liberal Party and will succeed Justin Trudeau as prime minister.

title.children: Trudeau successor as Canada PM revealed, takes swipe at Trump
